        public int findClosest(double[][] cities,
                       int current,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> visited)
        can only take in unvisited cities
        Parameters:
        cities - List of all cities to visit
        current - the current city to move from
        visited - list of all cities that have been visited
        Returns:
        the number that represents the closest city to move to

      • execute

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> execute()
        Runs the Tsp. Starts at city 0 and uses a greedy algorithm to find the closes city to it. It then chooses that city as next point and repeats through the whole list of cities. It adds each visited city to path. Returner is just to make the returning object the expected type for the client
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Task
        Returns:
        T
